meanings.sent1: The coevality of the twins was evident in their identical appearance.
meanings.sent2: The coevality of the students in the class made it easier for them to relate to each other.
meanings.sent3: The coevality of the trees in the forest led to some confusion among the animals.
meanings.sent4: The coevality of the stars in the night sky created a sense of unity and harmony.
meanings.sent5: The coevality of the siblings was striking, as they shared the same birthday.

meanings.definition: The quality of being of the same age or duration.
meanings.sent1: The coevality of the buildings in the historic district added to its charm.
meanings.sent2: The coevality of the team members ensured a smooth workflow.
meanings.sent3: The coevality of the clouds in the sky made for a picturesque view.
meanings.sent4: The coevality of the waves crashing on the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The coevality of the books on the shelf indicated a shared publication year.
